content.content: 1→--- 2→import MainLayout from '../../layouts/MainLayout.astro'; 3→import Breadcrumb from '../../components/Breadcrumb.astro'; 4→import ProductCard from '../../components/ProductCard.astro'; 5→import AddToQuoteBtn from '../../components/islands/AddToQuoteBtn.tsx'; 6→import VariantSelector from '../../components/islands/VariantSelector.tsx'; 7→import ImageGallery from '../../components/islands/ImageGallery.tsx'; 8→import RecentlyViewed from '../../components/islands/RecentlyViewed.tsx'; 9→import { getCollection } from 'astro:content'; 10→import { siteConfig } from '../../data/site-config'; 11→import { slugify } from '../../utils/slugify'; 12→import { applicationTags } from '../../data/application-tags'; 13→import { complementaryCategories } from '../../data/complementary-categories'; 14→import { getCategoryPlaceholderSvg } from '../../utils/category-placeholders'; 15→ 16→export async function getStaticPaths() { 17→ const products = (await getCollection('products')).filter(p => p.data.categorySlug !== 'servicios'); 18→ return products.map(product => { 19→ const sameCategory = products.filter( 20→ p => p.data.categorySlug === product.data.categorySlug && p.data.sku !== product.data.sku 21→ ); 22→ const sorted = [...sameCategory].sort((a, b) => a.data.sku.localeCompare(b.data.sku)); 23→ let related = sorted.slice(0, 4); 24→ 25→ if (related.length < 3) { 26→ const otherCategory = products.filter( 27→ p => p.data.categorySlug !== product.data.categorySlug && p.data.sku !== product.data.sku 28→ ); 29→ const otherSorted = [...otherCategory].sort((a, b) => a.data.sku.localeCompare(b.data.sku)); 30→ related = [...related, ...otherSorted.slice(0, 4 - related.length)]; 31→ } 32→ 33→ // Complementary products from related categories 34→ const compCategorySlugs = complementaryCategories[product.data.categorySlug] || []; 35→ const complementary = products 36→ .filter(p => compCategorySlugs.includes(p.data.categorySlug) && p.data.sku !== product.data.sku) 37→ .sort((a, b) => a.data.sku.localeCompare(b.data.sku)) 38→ .slice(0, 4); 39→ 40→ return { 41→ params: { slug: slugify(product.data.title) }, 42→ props: { 43→ product: product.data, 44→ relatedProducts: related.map(p => p.data), 45→ complementaryProducts: complementary.map(p => p.data), 46→ }, 47→ }; 48→ }); 49→} 50→ 51→const { product, relatedProducts, complementaryProducts } = Astro.props; 52→const specsEntries = Object.entries(product.specs); 53→const allImages = [ 54→ ...(product.image ? [product.image] : []), 55→ ...(product.images || []), 56→]; 57→const tags = applicationTags[product.categorySlug] || []; 58→const productSlug = slugify(product.title); 59→ 60→// Spec icon mapping for stat cards 61→const specIconMap: Record = { 62→ 'material': '', 63→ 'peso': '', 64→ 'longitud': '', 65→ 'largo': '', 66→ 'diámetro': '', 67→ 'resistencia': '', 68→ 'capacidad': '', 69→ 'voltaje': '', 70→ 'corriente': '', 71→ 'temperatura': '', 72→ 'vida': '', 73→ 'profundidad': '', 74→ 'conexión': '', 75→ 'tipo': '', 76→ 'norma': '', 77→ 'dimensiones': '', 78→}; 79→const defaultSpecIcon = ''; 80→ 81→function getSpecIcon(label: string): string { 82→ const lower = label.toLowerCase(); 83→ for (const [key, svg] of Object.entries(specIconMap)) { 84→ if (lower.includes(key)) return svg; 85→ } 86→ return defaultSpecIcon; 87→} 88→--- 89→ 90→ 91→ {/* JSON-LD Product schema for Google Shopping / Rich Results */} 92→ 432→ 433→ 1230→

content.text:
In the directory c:\Users\V\Documents\GitHub\Pagiweb2\src, search for all CSS rules that set `color: var(--color-primary)` (NOT background, NOT border, just color). For each match, check if there's a corresponding dark mode override (`:global([data-theme="dark"])` or `[data-theme="dark"]`) for that same class. Report ONLY the ones that are MISSING dark mode overrides. Exclude SVG stroke/fill properties.

Context: `var(--color-primary)` = `#0052CC` which is a dark blue that's hard to read on dark backgrounds. In dark mode, it should typically be overridden to `#60a5fa`.

message.content:
Your task is to create a detailed summary of the conversation so far, paying close attention to the user's explicit requests and your previous actions.
This summary should be thorough in capturing technical details, code patterns, and architectural decisions that would be essential for continuing development work without losing context.

Before providing your final summary, wrap your analysis in <analysis> tags to organize your thoughts and ensure you've covered all necessary points. In your analysis process:

1. Chronologically analyze each message and section of the conversation. For each section thoroughly identify:
   - The user's explicit requests and intents
   - Your approach to addressing the user's requests
   - Key decisions, technical concepts and code patterns
   - Specific details like:
     - file names
     - full code snippets
     - function signatures
     - file edits
  - Errors that you ran into and how you fixed them
  - Pay special attention to specific user feedback that you received, especially if the user told you to do something differently.
2. Double-check for technical accuracy and completeness, addressing each required element thoroughly.

Your summary should include the following sections:

1. Primary Request and Intent: Capture all of the user's explicit requests and intents in detail
2. Key Technical Concepts: List all important technical concepts, technologies, and frameworks discussed.
3. Files and Code Sections: Enumerate specific files and code sections examined, modified, or created. Pay special attention to the most recent messages and include full code snippets where applicable and include a summary of why this file read or edit is important.
4. Errors and fixes: List all errors that you ran into, and how you fixed them. Pay special attention to specific user feedback that you received, especially if the user told you to do something differently.
5. Problem Solving: Document problems solved and any ongoing troubleshooting efforts.
6. All user messages: List ALL user messages that are not tool results. These are critical for understanding the users' feedback and changing intent.
6. Pending Tasks: Outline any pending tasks that you have explicitly been asked to work on.
7. Current Work: Describe in detail precisely what was being worked on immediately before this summary request, paying special attention to the most recent messages from both user and assistant. Include file names and code snippets where applicable.
8. Optional Next Step: List the next step that you will take that is related to the most recent work you were doing. IMPORTANT: ensure that this step is DIRECTLY in line with the user's most recent explicit requests, and the task you were working on immediately before this summary request. If your last task was concluded, then only list next steps if they are explicitly in line with the users request. Do not start on tangential requests or really old requests that were already completed without confirming with the user first.
                       If there is a next step, include direct quotes from the most recent conversation showing exactly what task you were working on and where you left off. This should be verbatim to ensure there's no drift in task interpretation.

Here's an example of how your output should be structured:

<example>
<analysis>
[Your thought process, ensuring all points are covered thoroughly and accurately]
</analysis>

<summary>
1. Primary Request and Intent:
   [Detailed description]

2. Key Technical Concepts:
   - [Concept 1]
   - [Concept 2]
   - [...]

3. Files and Code Sections:
   - [File Name 1]
      - [Summary of why this file is important]
      - [Summary of the changes made to this file, if any]
      - [Important Code Snippet]
   - [File Name 2]
      - [Important Code Snippet]
   - [...]

4. Errors and fixes:
    - [Detailed description of error 1]:
      - [How you fixed the error]
      - [User feedback on the error if any]
    - [...]

5. Problem Solving:
   [Description of solved problems and ongoing troubleshooting]

6. All user messages: 
    - [Detailed non tool use user message]
    - [...]

7. Pending Tasks:
   - [Task 1]
   - [Task 2]
   - [...]

8. Current Work:
   [Precise description of current work]

9. Optional Next Step:
   [Optional Next step to take]

</summary>
</example>

Please provide your summary based on the conversation so far, following this structure and ensuring precision and thoroughness in your response. 

There may be additional summarization instructions provided in the included context. If so, remember to follow these instructions when creating the above summary. Examples of instructions include:
<example>
## Compact Instructions
When summarizing the conversation focus on typescript code changes and also remember the mistakes you made and how you fixed them.
</example>

<example>
# Summary instructions
When you are using compact - please focus on test output and code changes. Include file reads verbatim.
</example>


IMPORTANT: Do NOT use any tools. You MUST respond with ONLY the <summary>...</summary> block as your text output.

content.text:
<analysis>
Let me chronologically analyze the conversation:

**Context from previous session (summarized):**
- Added ~101 MCM variants to 8 mold product JSON files
- Converted ~50 PNG images to webp for 14 mol-*.json files
- Implemented imageMap feature, added orphan models, created new products
- Created CCD-001 and FLC-001 products
- Current state: 59 products, 66 pages, build passes
- First round of dark mode fixes was completed: nosotros.astro icons, FAQ.astro broken vars, product-card.css, CategoryCard.astro, multiple pages with #94a3b8 → #b0bec5 fixes
- User reported VariantSelector dark mode issues
- A plan was written for fixing VariantSelector dark mode but ExitPlanMode was NOT called

**Current session starts:**

1. **ExitPlanMode called** - Plan for VariantSelector dark mode fixes was approved by user.

2. **VariantSelector.module.css fixes implemented** - Read lines 660-810, then applied 17 individual Edit operations to fix ~30 broken dark mode rules:
   - Text colors: `.label` → `#e2e8f0`, `.modelCardName` → `#f1f5f9`, `.configTitle` → `#e2e8f0`, `.cableLabel` → `#e2e8f0`, `.qtyInput color` → `#f1f5f9`, `.headingText`/`.stepLabel`/`.barPill`/`.ctaCount` → `#b0bec5`, `.modelLabel`/`.modelCardSub`/`.modelStaticLabel`/`.qtyBtn color` → `#b0bec5`
   - Backgrounds: `.modelCard`/`.barContainer`/`.qtyInput` → `#1e293b`, `.barPill`/`.qtyBtn`/`.gaugeDot` → `#334155`, `.qtyBtn:hover`/`.addBtn:disabled` → `#475569`
   - Borders: `.selectorHeading` → `#334155`, `.modelCard`/`.qtyControls`/`.qtyInput`/`.barPill`/`.ctaArea` → `#475569`, `.modelRadio` → `#64748b`, `.barDot` → `#1e293b`
   - Build verified: 66 pages, 0 errors

3. **User message 2** - User shared 2 screenshots showing:
   - Homepage: feature cards with dim/invisible icons at top
   - Product detail (barra-toma-tierra-copperweld): stat card icons nearly invisible, spec labels OK but icons gone
   - User said: "aun faltan hay letra que no se logran ver en el dark mode y los iconos en los productos tampoco se ven bien"

4. **Deep investigation of root causes:**
   - Read dark-mode.css and discovered two root causes:
     a. `--color-white` is redefined to `#1e293b` in dark mode (line 9 of dark-mode.css), so ANY element using `color: var(--color-white)` becomes invisible on dark backgrounds
     b. `--color-primary` stays `#0052CC` in dark mode (not overridden), which is too dark to read on dark backgrounds
   - Systematically grepped for all `color: var(--color-white)` usages across src/ (found 40+ instances)
   - Systematically checked which had dark mode overrides and which didn't
   - Used Explore agent to audit all `color: var(--color-primary)` usages missing dark mode overrides

5. **Comprehensive fixes applied across 11 files:**

   **index.astro:**
   - Added `.feature-icon` dark mode override (icons were invisible due to `color: var(--color-white)` → `#1e293b`)
   - Added `.feature-card:hover .feature-icon` dark mode
   - Added `.cta-founder strong` dark mode override

   **productos/[slug].astro:**
   - Added `.stat-card-icon` dark mode override (completely missing - icons invisible)
   - Improved `.trust-card-icon` dark mode (was using too-dark `#1e40af`/`#1e3a8a`)
   - Added `.detail-badge` dark mode override
   - Added `.detail-category` dark mode override

   **nosotros.astro:**
   - Added `.founder-badge` dark mode override

   **faq.astro:**
   - Added `.page-hero` dark mode override (title was invisible)

   **cotizacion.astro:**
   - Removed duplicate `.page-hero-title` dark mode rule

   **dark-mode.css:**
   - Added `.btn-secondary` base state dark mode override (color + border)

   **DarkModeToggle.module.css:**
   - Added `color: #ffffff` to dark mode `.theme-toggle`

   **ImageGallery.module.css:**
   - Added `.gallery-badge` dark mode override
   - Added `.lightbox-close` and `.lightbox-arrow` dark mode overrides

   **QuoteItems.module.css:**
   - Added `.qty-btn:hover` dark mode override
   - Added `.remove-item-btn:hover` dark mode override
   - Added `.quote-item-category` dark mode override
   - Added `.quote-summary-total` dark mode override
   - Added `.quote-items-footer strong` dark mode override

   **QuoteForm.module.css:**
   - Added `.qty-btn:hover` dark mode override
   - Added `.remove-item-btn:hover` dark mode override
   - Added `.step-number` dark mode override

6. **Build verified:** 66 pages, 0 errors

No explicit pending tasks from the user. The work was completed and build verified.
</analysis>

<summary>
1. Primary Request and Intent:
   The user requested dark mode improvements across the GelChile website, with two rounds of feedback:
   
   **Round 1 (prior session, completed):** "vamos a hacer mejoras en el dark mode en especial en el color de las letras y por ejemplo en el color de los iconos" — Initial dark mode fixes for text contrast (#94a3b8 → #b0bec5), icon colors, and broken CSS variable references in FAQ.astro and faq.astro.
   
   **Round 2 (prior session, plan created):** "aun hay problemas de colores, por ejemplo el varianteselector no se ve bien en dark mode" — VariantSelector had ~30 broken dark mode rules. A plan was written but ExitPlanMode was not called.
   
   **Round 3 (current session):** After VariantSelector fixes were applied, user shared 2 new screenshots showing: (a) homepage feature card icons invisible, (b) product detail stat card icons invisible. User said: "aun faltan hay letra que no se logran ver en el dark mode y los iconos en los productos tampoco se ven bien" — requesting fixes for remaining invisible text and product page icons in dark mode.

2. Key Technical Concepts:
   - **CSS Variable Inversion System:** In `[data-theme="dark"]`, the gray scale inverts: `--color-gray-50` (#f8fafc → #1e293b), up to `--color-gray-900` (#0f172a → #ffffff). This means low numbers become dark (for backgrounds) and high numbers become light (for text).
   - **Critical Bug: `--color-white` redefinition:** `--color-white` is set to `#1e293b` in dark mode (dark-mode.css line 9). Any element using `color: var(--color-white)` for text/icons becomes INVISIBLE on dark backgrounds. This was used extensively for icons and text on colored backgrounds (hero sections, buttons, badges).
   - **Critical Bug: `--color-primary` not overridden:** `--color-primary` stays `#0052CC` in dark mode. On dark backgrounds, this dark blue is nearly unreadable. Should be overridden to `#60a5fa` for text/icon contexts.
   - **Fix Pattern for icons:** `background: rgba(96, 165, 250, 0.15); color: #60a5fa;` — consistent pattern used across stat-card-icon, trust-card-icon, feature-icon, value-icon, contact-icon
   - **Fix Pattern for text on colored backgrounds:** Replace `var(--color-white)` with hardcoded `#ffffff` in dark mode overrides
   - **Fix Pattern for primary-colored text:** Replace `var(--color-primary)` with `#60a5fa` in dark mode overrides
   - **Astro CSS Modules:** Use `:global([data-theme="dark"]) .className` for dark mode in scoped component styles
   - **Regular CSS files:** Use `[data-theme="dark"] .className` (without `:global()`)

3. Files and Code Sections:

   - **`src/styles/dark-mode.css`** — Global dark mode variable definitions and overrides
     - Contains the root cause: `--color-white: #1e293b` (line 9) and `--color-primary-50: rgba(0, 82, 204, 0.2)` (line 24)
     - `--color-primary-light: #60a5fa` (line 25) — the correct bright blue for dark mode
     - Added `.btn-secondary` base state dark mode:
     ```css
     [data-theme="dark"] .btn-secondary {
       color: #60a5fa;
       border-color: #60a5fa;
     }
     ```

   - **`src/components/islands/VariantSelector.module.css`** — Preact island CSS Module (855 lines)
     - Fixed ~30 broken dark mode rules (lines 673-807) replacing CSS variables with hardcoded hex
     - Key fixes: `.label` → `#e2e8f0`, `.modelCardName` → `#f1f5f9`, `.modelCard bg` → `#1e293b`, `.selectorHeading border` → `#334155`, `.qtyBtn bg` → `#334155`, `.barPill` → border `#475569` / bg `#334155` / color `#b0bec5`
     - Rules left untouched: those using `rgba()`, `var(--color-primary-light)`, scrollbar rules

   - **`src/pages/index.astro`** — Homepage
     - Added feature-icon dark mode override (icons were invisible):
     ```css
     :global([data-theme="dark"]) .feature-icon {
       background: linear-gradient(135deg, rgba(96, 165, 250, 0.15) 0%, rgba(59, 130, 246, 0.25) 100%);
       color: #60a5fa;
     }
     :global([data-theme="dark"]) .feature-card:hover .feature-icon {
       background: linear-gradient(135deg, rgba(96, 165, 250, 0.3) 0%, rgba(59, 130, 246, 0.4) 100%);
       box-shadow: 0 8px 20px rgba(59, 130, 246, 0.2);
     }
     :global([data-theme="dark"]) .cta-founder strong {
       color: #ffffff;
     }
     ```

   - **`src/pages/productos/[slug].astro`** — Product detail page
     - Added missing `.stat-card-icon` dark mode (was completely absent — icons invisible):
     ```css
     :global([data-theme="dark"]) .stat-card-icon {
       background: rgba(96, 165, 250, 0.15);
       color: #60a5fa;
     }
     ```
     - Improved `.trust-card-icon` (was using too-dark #1e40af/#1e3a8a):
     ```css
     :global([data-theme="dark"]) .trust-card-icon {
       background: linear-gradient(135deg, rgba(96, 165, 250, 0.15) 0%, rgba(59, 130, 246, 0.25) 100%);
       color: #60a5fa;
     }
     ```
     - Added `.detail-badge` and `.detail-category` overrides:
     ```css
     :global([data-theme="dark"]) .detail-badge {
       color: #ffffff;
     }
     :global([data-theme="dark"]) .detail-category {
       background: rgba(96, 165, 250, 0.15);
       color: #60a5fa;
     }
     ```

   - **`src/pages/nosotros.astro`** — Added `.founder-badge` dark mode override:
     ```css
     :global([data-theme="dark"]) .founder-badge {
       color: #ffffff;
     }
     ```

   - **`src/pages/faq.astro`** — Added missing `.page-hero` dark mode (title/subtitle were invisible):
     ```css
     :global([data-theme="dark"]) .page-hero {
       color: #ffffff;
     }
     ```

   - **`src/pages/cotizacion.astro`** — Removed duplicate `.page-hero-title` dark mode rule

   - **`src/components/islands/DarkModeToggle.module.css`** — Added `color: #ffffff;` to dark mode toggle:
     ```css
     :global([data-theme="dark"]) .theme-toggle {
       background: linear-gradient(135deg, var(--color-accent) 0%, var(--color-accent-dark) 100%);
       color: #ffffff;
     }
     ```

   - **`src/components/islands/ImageGallery.module.css`** — Added dark mode overrides:
     ```css
     :global([data-theme="dark"]) .gallery-badge {
       color: #ffffff;
     }
     :global([data-theme="dark"]) .lightbox-close,
     :global([data-theme="dark"]) .lightbox-arrow {
       color: #ffffff;
     }
     ```

   - **`src/components/islands/QuoteItems.module.css`** — Added dark mode overrides:
     ```css
     :global([data-theme="dark"]) .qty-btn:hover {
       color: #ffffff;
     }
     :global([data-theme="dark"]) .remove-item-btn:hover {
       color: #ffffff;
     }
     :global([data-theme="dark"]) .quote-item-category {
       background: rgba(96, 165, 250, 0.15);
       color: #60a5fa;
     }
     :global([data-theme="dark"]) .quote-summary-total {
       color: #60a5fa;
     }
     :global([data-theme="dark"]) .quote-items-footer strong {
       color: #60a5fa;
     }
     ```

   - **`src/components/islands/QuoteForm.module.css`** — Added dark mode overrides:
     ```css
     :global([data-theme="dark"]) .qty-btn:hover {
       color: #ffffff;
     }
     :global([data-theme="dark"]) .remove-item-btn:hover {
       color: #ffffff;
     }
     :global([data-theme="dark"]) .step-number {
       color: #ffffff;
     }
     ```

4. Errors and Fixes:
   - **VariantSelector dark mode broken (prior plan):** ~30 CSS rules used inverted `var(--color-gray-N)` variables causing text to use background colors and vice versa. Fixed by replacing all with hardcoded hex values following consistent dark mode palette.
   - **`var(--color-white)` becomes `#1e293b` in dark mode:** Discovered this was the root cause of invisible icons/text across the site. Any element using `color: var(--color-white)` on a dark/colored background became invisible. Fixed by adding explicit `color: #ffffff;` dark mode overrides for each affected element.
   - **`var(--color-primary)` = `#0052CC` stays unchanged in dark mode:** Too dark to read on dark backgrounds. Fixed by adding `color: #60a5fa;` dark mode overrides for text elements using this variable.
   - **Missing `.stat-card-icon` dark mode override entirely:** The stat card icons on product detail pages had no dark mode styling at all — `background: var(--color-primary-50)` became nearly invisible and `color: var(--color-primary)` was dark blue on dark. Fixed by adding the override.
   - **FAQ page hero title invisible:** `.page-hero { color: var(--color-white); }` had no dark mode override, making both title and subtitle invisible. Fixed by adding `:global([data-theme="dark"]) .page-hero { color: #ffffff; }`.
   - **Duplicate rule in cotizacion.astro:** Two identical `.page-hero-title` dark mode overrides. Cleaned up by removing the duplicate.
   - **Tool error:** Edit tool on DarkModeToggle.module.css failed with "File has not been read yet" despite being read earlier in the conversation (likely due to context compression). Fixed by re-reading the file before editing.

5. Problem Solving:
   - Systematically identified the two root causes (`--color-white` redefinition and `--color-primary` not overridden) by reading dark-mode.css variable definitions
   - Performed comprehensive grep audit of all `color: var(--color-white)` usages (40+ instances) across src/
   - Used Explore agent to audit all `color: var(--color-primary)` usages missing dark mode overrides
   - Verified each finding against existing dark mode overrides to avoid duplicating already-covered rules
   - Applied consistent patterns: `#60a5fa` for primary text, `rgba(96, 165, 250, 0.15)` for icon backgrounds, `#ffffff` for text on colored backgrounds
   - Build verified after each round of changes: 66 pages, 0 errors

6. All User Messages:
   - (Prior session) "vamos a hacer mejoras en el dark mode en especial en el color de las letras y por ejemplo en el color de los iconos" — with 4 screenshots of nosotros page
   - (Prior session) "aun hay problemas de colores, por ejemplo el varianteselector no se ve bien en dark mode" — with 3 screenshots showing BTT-001 product detail
   - (Current session) "aun faltan hay letra que no se logran ver en el dark mode y los iconos en los productos tampoco se ven bien" — with 2 screenshots showing: homepage feature cards with invisible icons, product detail (barra-toma-tierra-copperweld) with invisible stat card icons

7. Pending Tasks:
   - No explicitly pending tasks. All identified dark mode issues have been fixed and build verified.
   - User may want to visually verify the changes and provide feedback on any remaining issues.

8. Current Work:
   Completed comprehensive dark mode audit and fixes across 11 files. The last action was building and verifying (66 pages, 0 errors). All todo items were marked complete. The work addressed:
   - VariantSelector ~30 broken dark mode rules (from approved plan)
   - Homepage feature icons invisible (`.feature-icon`)
   - Product detail stat card icons invisible (`.stat-card-icon` missing entirely)
   - Product detail trust card icons too dark (`.trust-card-icon`)
   - Product detail badge and category text (`.detail-badge`, `.detail-category`)
   - FAQ page hero text invisible (`.page-hero`)
   - DarkModeToggle icon, ImageGallery controls, QuoteItems/QuoteForm button hover states and category labels
   - `.btn-secondary` base state, `.founder-badge` on nosotros page

9. Optional Next Step:
   The dark mode fixes are complete and build-verified. The natural next step is for the user to visually verify the changes in the browser and provide feedback if any remaining issues are visible. No further action needed unless the user identifies additional problems.
</summary>
